result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel E. Negethon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Deliver Illegal Articles to Inmate [Modifiers: Solicitation of, Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 302.095(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any other sentence including but not limited to Fond du Lac County 2014CF317.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. The defendant is to have NO Contact with K. Beesley (as named in the complaint).
Defendant is to comply with any rules/recommendations as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: 3:08 pm case called. Defendant Daniel E. Negethon in court with attorney William Michael Lennon.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement stated on the record.   Amended Information filed with the Court. Attorney Lennon confirms receipt, waives formal reading.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: No Contest. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Court dismisses and reads-in Counts 2 & 3. Sentencing argument by DA Blader. Sentencing argument by Attorney Lennon. Statement by the defendant. Court makes statement prior to sentencing. Court sentences the defendant to: SWD and places on probation for a period of 2 years, consecutive to any other case including but not limited to Fond du Lac County Case 14CF317. CONDITIONS: AODA and follow through,  maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. No Contact with K. Beesley.  Terms of Agent. Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. Appeal Rights Given.
Petition and Order for Writ of Habeas Corpus ad Prosequendum

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney William Michael Lennon in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Lennon states matter resolved.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 22, 2015 at 03:15 pm.
Status conference on March 18, 2015 at 01:50 pm.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney William Michael Lennon in court appears telephonically.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Lennon requesting another STC date.  Status conference scheduled for March 18, 2015 at 01:50 pm.
Status conference on February 23, 2015 at 02:45 pm.

Case Called @ 3:02 PM:  Defendant Daniel E. Negethon in court with attorney William Michael Lennon.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading waived.  Atty Lennon moves for withdrawal of Motion for Change of Venue - request withdrawn and confirmed by Def.  Court entertains waiver of pre-lim hearing in its entirety.  Court accepts knowing and voluntary waiver of pre-lim hearing in its entirety.  Def BOT.  INFO Filed - Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  NGP received and entered to all counts.  Atty Lennon argues as to bond modification - lesser cash or signature bond.  Def currently on ES in FDL Co.  Argument by DA as to bond modification - requests cash bond to remain as ordered.  The Court:  Respectfully declines to modify bond at this time.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Status conference scheduled for February 23, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
State's
Adjourned initial appearance on February 6, 2015 at 03:15 pm.
for Change of Venue

ADDRESS INFO for Daniel E. Negethon
Current: 72 E Arndt St, Fond du Lac, WI 54935 United States  (Effective: 01-20-2015)
Prior: 1006 CTH EE, c/o Redgranite Correctional Institution, Redgranite, WI 54970
Request for Detainer from WCSD to RGCI Dated 1/15/2015
Initial appearance on February 2, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.  Complete ID process with the Sheriff's Department.

Case Called @ 1:03 PM: Defendant Daniel E. Negethon in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Def wants counsel - has has not contacted SPD for eligibility.  Def referred to SPD for eligibility process.  It is presumed he will qualify.  ADA argues as to bond - cash bond in light of pending release date coming up very soon and pending criminal charges.  Inherent flight risk.  Statement as to bond request - currently on Signature Bond in Fond du Lac Co.  No funds available to post cash bond.  He will be released to ES upon release from RGCI.  The Court:  Orders cash bond due to pending charges.  Court does not intend to impede participation in Drug Court Program in FDL Co.  More stability needed before the Court would re-address bond.  Atty Jeff Haase represents Def in FDL Co.  Def must contact FDL Co SPD office and advise counsel of this matter.  IA  Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  At this time Def is referred to SPD for representation - that request will be honored today and IA adjourned.  Initial appearance scheduled for February 2, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
From defendant to court-requesting to be produced for January 13, 2014 hearing
